Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the power of the President in deciding to "open up the states" without considering the authority of governors.
Understate: The claim may understate the power and authority of governors in making decisions to reopen businesses and public spaces in their states.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that it is solely the decision of the President to open up the states.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the President has complete decision-making authority over reopening states, without considering the role of governors and their legal rights.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that governors have the power to order closures and reopen businesses and public spaces in their states.
